english: Why is it that you want to be a flight attendant?
thai: tham-mai phûeng thǔeng yàak bpen aae-hóos-dtèet rǒoe khráp.

english: Because I would get to travel to foreign countries often.
thai: phráw jà dâai dooen-thaang bpai dtàang-bprà-thêet bàwy-bàwy jâ.

english: And which country do you most want to go to?
thai: láaeo phûeng yàak bpai bprà-thêet à-rai mâak thîi-sùt khráp.

english: Um...I want to go to Switzerland the most.
thai: uuem...yàak bpai bprà-thêet sà-wíit-sooe-laaen mâak thîi-sùt jâ.

english: How come?
thai: phráw à-rai rǒoe khráp.

english: Because I want to see snow. Since I was born, still never seen snow.
thai: phráw phûeng yàak hěn hì-má jâ. dtâng dtàae gòoet maa yang mâi khooei hěn hì-má looei.

english: There's a lot of snow in America. But I don't like it.
thai: thîi à-mee-rí-gaa mii hì-má yóe mâak looei khráp. dtàae phǒm mâi châawp.

english: Why don't you like it? The snow isn't beautiful?
thai: tham-mai mâi châawp lâ khá. hì-má sǔuai mâi châi rǒoe khá.

english: It's true that snow is beautiful, but I think it's too cold when it's snowing.
thai: jing yùu khráp thîi wâa hì-má sǔuai. dtàae phǒm khít wâa man nǎao gooen bpai wee-laa hì-má dtòk.

english: Why are you going to go to Thailand?
thai: khun jà bpai muueang-thai tham-mai

english: Why do you need to go to Thailand?
thai: tham-mai khun dtâwng bpai muueang-thai (When using a helping verb such as dtâwng then tham-mai comes at the beginning of the question)

english: Why is it that you're going to go to Thailand?
thai: tham-mai khun thǔeng jà bpai muueang-thai (Put together thmai thǔeng means "Why has it become that...?" If you also state the subject, then thǔeng goes after the subject)

english: I'm very hungry because I didn't eat breakfast.
thai: phǒm hǐu mâak phráw wâa mâi dâi gin aa-hǎan-cháao (We use phráw wâa to link separate clauses of a sentence where the second clause gives the reason for what happened in the first clause)

english: snow
thai: hì-má

english: snowing
thai: hì-má dtòk

english: often
thai: bàwy-bàwy

english: foreign country
thai: dtàang-bprà-thêet

english: breakfast
thai: aa-hǎan-cháao

english: since
thai: dtâng dtàae

english: was born
thai: gòoet maa
lesson audio
english: lesson audio
